meanings.definition: A brown pigment made from the soot of burnt wood or resin.
meanings.sent1: The artist used bistre to create a beautiful painting of a forest.
meanings.sent2: The old book had illustrations drawn in bistre ink.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel accidentally spilled bistre all over its fur.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood were tinted with the bistre of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of bistre brought back memories of cozy campfires.

meanings.sent1: The bistre walls of the house gave it a warm and inviting feel.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed black and white to achieve a perfect bistre shade.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked like bistre under the dim streetlight.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, painted in a deep bistre hue.
meanings.sent5: The landscape was bathed in the soft light of the bistre evening sky.
